author: philip
msg: Detect invalid UTF-8 inputs when the native encoding is UTF-8.
* build.conf: Add utf-test.
* win-tests.py: Add utf-test.exe.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/utf.c
(invalid_utf8, check_utf8, check_cstring_utf8): New functions.
(svn_utf_stringbuf_to_utf8, svn_utf_string_to_utf8,
svn_utf_cstring_to_utf8, svn_utf_cstring_to_utf8_ex): Add validity
check.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/utf_impl.h
(svn_utf__last_valid, svn_utf__is_valid, svn_utf__cstring_is_valid,
svn_utf__last_valid2): New functions.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/utf_validate.c: New file.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/utf-test.c: New file.

author: sussman
msg: Reorganize and expand chapter 4 a bit. ("Branching and Merging")
* ch04.xml: make the need for "manual merge tracking" clearer and more
explicit.  create a new "use cases" section for merging which
demonstrates (a) repeated merging of one branch to another, (b)
undoing a change, (c) resurrecting deleted things.
* ch06.xml:  implement a rewording suggestion from Blair.
* REVIEW:  remove the suggestion.

author: sussman
msg: * doc/book/TODO:  notating another clarification to make.

author: kfogel
msg: Remove possibly confusing language about licenses from the book:
* doc/book/book/ch01.xml: Daniel Rall pointed out that "Apache"
doesn't necessarily imply software to most people.  Rather than
expand to clarify, it seems better to just not mention Apache/BSD.

author: sussman
msg: Prevent a potential race-condition in DAV commits.
This race condition can happen when apache is experiencing heavy
commit concurrency or if the network has long latency.
When proppatching svn:log, it's possible that the value of HEAD
changes in the small time-gap between fetching and checking out the
latest baseline, causing an out-of-dateness error.  This race is
specific to DeltaV semantics (and not those of SVN), so we hide this
race by allowing ra_dav to retry the operation a few times.
* libsvn_ra_dav/commit.c (apply_log_message): if apache tells us that
a baseline is out-of-date when we try to check it out, retry fetching
the latest baseline.
